net.rim.device.api.ui.component.table
Class DataTemplate

java.lang.Object
  net.rim.device.api.ui.component.table.DataTemplate
Direct Known Subclasses:
RichListDataTemplate, SimpleListDataTemplate
public abstract class DataTemplate
extends Object

Define a repeating layout of fields from data obtained from the model associated with the DataTemplate's view.

Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0

Constructor Detail

DataTemplate

public DataTemplate(DataView view,
                    int rows,
                    int columns)
Create a DataTemplate for the provided view that has the provided number of rows and columns.

Parameters:
view - the DataView that will use this template to DataTemplate to arrange fields that contain the data in the model
rows - the number of rows in the repeating pattern
columns - the number of columns in the repeating pattern
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - thrown if rows or columns is a number less then 0.
Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0


Method Detail

createRegion

public int createRegion(XYRect rect,
                        RegionStyles style)
Create a region that can span rows and or columns using the specified style. The rect parameter needs four integers to define it.
  • The first integer is rect.x, which denotes the column number of the upper-left corner of the region
  • The second integer is rect.y, which denotes the row number of the upper-left corner of the region
  • The third integer is rect.width, which is the number of spanned columns
  • The fourth integer is rect.height, which is the number of spanned rows.

Parameters:
rect - A container of data that describes the root of a region and the number of rows and columns that are spanned by this region.
style - the RegionSytle to use for this region.
Returns:
the region number
Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0

createRegion

public int createRegion(XYRect rect)
Create a region that can span rows and or columns using the default style.

Parameters:
rect - a container of data that describes the root of a region and the number of rows and columns that are spanned by this region, rect.x and rect.y is the upper left corner of the region in terms of rows and columns, rect.width is the number of spanned columns, and rect.height is the number of spanned rows.
Returns:
the region number
Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0

getDataFields

public abstract Field[] getDataFields(int modelRowIndex)
Get the required fields that contain the data in the provided model row. When defining this method use the modelRowIndex to query the TableModel for the Java Object stored at that row index. Please note that it is permissible for null objects to exist as individual table model cells. There is no need to deal with the case of an entire model row being null because it is not permissible in the TableModel to specify an entire model row as null. Please note that the Field[] that is returned by this call must not have any null entries, consider the use of a { @link NullField } object in such situations.

Parameters:
modelRowIndex - the model row number that the returned fields contain
Returns:
the fields containing the data from the provided row in the model.
Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0

Get the column properties for the provided column.

Parameters:
columnIndex - the column number to get the column properties for
Returns:

Throws:

Check if fixed height is enabled or disabled.

Since:

useFixedHeight

public void useFixedHeight(boolean status)
Enable and disable fixed height.

Parameters:
status - if true then the height of a field is limited to the height set in the row properties, otherwise the field can grow or shrink
Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0
